Beef Stroganoff

A rich and creamy beef stroganoff made with tender top sirloin steak, mushrooms, and a luscious sour cream sauce. Perfect over pasta or rice.

Yield: 4 servings

beef

Ingredients

Main Ingredients

  • 1 lb beef (top sirloin steak, thinly sliced into strips; or ground beef)
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1/2 medium onion, finely chopped
  • 1/2 lb brown mushrooms, finely diced
  • 1 garlic clove, minced
  • 1 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup beef broth
  • 3/4 cup heavy whipping cream
  • 1/4 cup sour cream
  • 1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 1/2 tsp dijon mustard
  • 1/2 tsp salt
  • 1/4 tsp black pepper

Procedure

Prepare the Beef - steak

  1. Place a large deep pan or dutch oven over medium-high heat.
  2. Add 2 Tbsp oil, and once hot, add thinly sliced beef strips in a single layer.
  3. Cook 1 minute per side without stirring, until browned and no longer red.
  4. Sear beef in 2 batches to avoid overcrowding the pan.
  5. Remove beef to a plate and cover to keep warm.

Prepare the Beef - ground beef

  1. Place a large deep pan or dutch oven over medium-high heat.
  2. Add 2 Tbsp oil, and once hot, add ground beef.
  3. Cook until no longer red
  4. Remove to a bowl with paper towel and allow to drain

Cook the Vegetables

  1. Add 2 Tbsp butter to the same pan.
  2. Add chopped onion and diced mushrooms.
  3. Sautee 6–8 minutes until liquid evaporates and vegetables are soft and lightly browned.

Make the Sauce

  1. Add minced garlic clove and sautee until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
  2. Add 1 Tbsp flour and sautee another minute, stirring constantly.
  3. Pour in 1 cup beef broth, scraping any bits from the bottom of the pan.
  4. Add 3/4 cup whipping cream and simmer 1–2 minutes until slightly thickened.

Finish the Sauce

  1. Stir a few tablespoons of sauce into 1/4 cup sour cream to temper it.
  2. Add tempered sour cream to the pan while stirring constantly.
  3. Stir in Worcestershire sauce, dijon mustard, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Simmer until sauce is creamy.

Combine and Serve

  1. Add beef with accumulated juices back to the pan.
  2. Bring just to a simmer until beef is heated through.
  3. Serve over pasta or rice and enjoy.
